abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit Project
            supports the economic reform program launched by the
            government in response to the economic crisis. The crisis
            reflects the cumulative effects of years of poor economic
            management and weak fiscal discipline, exacerbated by the
            East Asian financial crisis and the collapse of its major
            export markets for logs. The project will help restore
            macroeconomic stability and move the economy to a path of
            sustainable growth and development, while mitigating the
            social cost of adjustment. The structural reforms will be
            implemented in the areas of : a) the public sector,
            reduction of the scope of government, rightsizing and
            restructuring of government and the civil service, and
            strengthening of planning, budget, accounting, and
            monitoring systems; b) the financial sector, normalization
            of financial relations with the government, liberalization,
            and strengthening of the Central Bank's regulatory and
            supervisory powers and capacities; c) forestry, measures to
            reduce exploitation to sustainable levels, minimize the
            environmental impact and benefit development; and d) private
            sector development, measures to stimulate a supply response,
            and improvements in public expenditure allocation to benefit
            the poor and vulnerable groups.
